sections.heading: Bonds; maturity; recitals.The maturity of all bonds shall be fixed on July 1 of the year in which they mature and shall contain a recital that the same were issued in accordance with the provisions of sections 31-336 to 31-348, and that they are to be paid out of a sinking fund to be created as prov
sections.text: Bonds; maturity; recitals.The maturity of all bonds shall be fixed on July 1 of the year in which they mature and shall contain a recital that the same were issued in accordance with the provisions of sections 31-336 to 31-348, and that they are to be paid out of a sinking fund to be created as provided in section 31-351.SourceLaws 1905, c. 161, § 20, p. 626;Laws 1907, c. 152, § 4, p. 471;Laws 1909, c. 147, § 10, p. 521;R.S.1913, § 1832;C.S.1922, § 1779;C.S.1929, § 31-436;R.S.1943, § 31-337.
